text: Heat 4 Yo Azz is the debut album by Vallejo, California rapper, Celly Cel. The album was released in 1994 for Sick Wid It Records and was produced by Celly Cel, Sam Bostic and Studio Ton. The album was mildly successful, making it to #34 on the Top R&B;/Hip-Hop album chart. Guests include B-Legit, E-40 and Funk Mobb. == Track listing == #"Heat 4 Yo Azz"- 4:22 #"Bailin' Thru My Hood" feat. B-Legit- 4:29 #"What Am I Supposed to Do"- 4:29 #"How to Catch a Bitch" feat. E-40, Mugzi & T-Pup- 4:21 #"Funk 4 Life" feat. Levitti- 4:34 #"Gin Wit No Juice"- 5:20 #"Retalliation" feat. E-40- 5:09 #"Tha Body Shop"- 3:18 #"Pimp's, Playa's and Hustla's" feat. Kaveo, Mac Shawn & Funk Mobb- 5:29 #"Hot Sunny Day" feat. Levitti & Marjuna Mitchell- 4:57 #"Nuthin' But Dick"- 5:37 #"Zig Zags & Body Bags" - 3:55 #"Empty tha Clip"- 4:29 ==Samples== Heat 4 Yo Azz *"Cutie Pie" by One Way What Am I Supposed to Do *"Rumpofsteelskin" by Parliament *"Love's Gonna Get'cha (Material Love)" by Boogie Down Productions ==References== Category:Celly Cel albums Category:1994 debut albums Category:Albums produced by Studio Ton
title: Heat 4 Yo Azz
